ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject

Notes: -1 = Screener; 0 = Baseline; 97 = Taper; 98 = Withdrawal; 99 = Interim contact; Otherwise: weeks since baseline

ElementDescription: Study; The code for each individual study
Notes: e.g., the name of the study in multi-grant collections

ElementDescription: Age of Onset: 0 = Greater Than or = 36 Months 1 = Less Than 36 Months
Notes: 0 = Greater than or equal to 36 months; 1 = Less than 36 months

ElementDescription: Is subject of Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin?

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: IQ score as defined by the completion of an appropriate assessement
Date that IQ test was given

Notes: 0=White; 1=Black or African American; 2=American Indian/Alaska Native; 3=Asian; 4=Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; 5=More than one race; 7=Unknown or not reported

ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

Notes: 0=White; 1=Black or African American; 2=American Indian/Alaska Native; 3=Asian; 4=Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; 5=More than one race; 7=Unknown or not reported
